question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following set.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits.)

(36, 90, 18)

(15, 35, 8)
solution:
(a)

Logic:- ( first num - third num ) × 5 = second num

(36, 90, 18)⇒( 36-18) × 5 = 90

(15, 35, 8)⇒ (15-8) × 5 = 35

Similarly,

(14, 45, 5)⇒ (14-5) × 5 = 45

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following set.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding /subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is NOT allowed)

(452, 50, 63)

(260, 35, 30)
solution:
(c)

Logic:- [ second num × 4 + third num × 4 = first num ]

(452, 50, 63) ⇒ 50 × 4 + 63 × 4 = 452

(260, 35, 30) ⇒ 35 × 4 + 30 × 4 = 260

Similarly,

(260, 50, 15) ⇒ 50×4 + 15×4 = 260

question: Three of the following letter-clusters are alike in some manner and hence form a group. Which letter-cluster does not belong to that group?

(a)

FYI ⇒ F + 3 = I, and F-7 = Y

RKU ⇒ R+3 = U, and R-7 = K

KDN ⇒ K+3 = N, and K-7 = D

CGB ⇒ C-1 = B, and C+4=G (not follows)

solution:

(8 - 81 ) ⇒ 8×10+1 = 81

question: Any natural mass of mineral matter that makes up the earth's crust is.
solution: (b)Rock. Types of rocks include Igneous rocks (formed by the solidification of magma and lava), Sedimentary rocks (formed by deposition of fragments of rocks by exogenous processes), and Metamorphic rocks (formed when rocks are subjected to high heat, high pressure). Fossils are an animal or plant that lived thousands of years ago which has turned into rock. The branch of biology that deals with the study of fossils is called paleontology.

question: Rajashree Shirke was given which of the following prestigious dance awards of 2013 for her excellence in Kathak?
solution: (a)Rajashree Shirke (kathak dancer) won Sangeet Natak Academy Award in 2013. Awards and Honors: Mumbai Mayor's Award for Women Achievers of the Year, Best Shikshak for the year 2007, and Title "Khosrovani" by Halim Academy of Sitar. Shambhu Maharaj was the first Kathak dancer to win Sangeet Natak Academy Award in 1955.

question: Who was the captain of the Indian hockey men's team at Olympic 2020?
solution: (a)Manpreet Singh. Olympic 2020 Indian winners: Neeraj Chopra (Javelin Throw, Gold), Ravi Dahiya (Wrestling (57 Kgs), Silver), Mirabai Chanu (Weightlifting for Women (49 Kgs), Silver), PV Sindhu (Women’s Single Badminton, Bronze), Indian Hockey Team (Hockey, Bronze), Lovlina Borgohain (Women’s Welterweight Boxing, Bronze), Bajrang Punia (Wrestling (65 Kgs), Bronze).

question: An exponent of Hindustani classical music, Gangubai Hangal was an eminent singer to have hailed from the gharana of the Hindustani Khyal family.
solution: (b)Gangubai Hangal (Karnataka) belonged to the Kirana gharana. Awards and Honors: Karnataka Sangeetha Nritya Academy Award (1962), Padma Bhushan (1971), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1973), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1996), and Padma Vibhushan (2002).

question: If we deduct depreciation from GNP the measure of aggregate income that we obtain is called.
solution: (c)NNP = GNP – Depreciation. Net national product (NNP) is the market value of all the finished goods and services that are produced by citizens of a nation, living domestically and internationally during a year. Gross Domestic Product at market prices is called Nominal GDP. Gross Domestic Product at constant price is called Real GDP. Personal Income = National Income - Corporate Income Taxes-Undistributed Corporate Profits- Social Security Contribution +Transfer Payments. GDP = C+I+G+(X-M) (C=Consumption, I=Investment, G=Government expenditure , and (X - M) =Export minus import).

question: The chemical formula of borax is.
solution: (b) Borax(tincal, sodium tetraborate decahydrate) is a natural mineral and a salt of boric acid. It is also known as sodium borate, sodium tetraborate, or disodium tetraborate. It is an important boron compound and its chemicalformula Na2B4O7·10H2O . It can be used in the testing of cleaning agent, insecticide, water softening agent and diabetes mellitus.

question: 32. OYO partnered with the Jammu and Kashmir administration to launch a rural tourism initiative. What is this initiative called?
solution: (b) Hospitality tech company OYO partnered with the Jammu and Kashmir administration to launch a rural tourism initiative, 'Crown of Incredible India', across the Union Territory to give a boost to the distressed tourism industry and turn the youth into start-up entrepreneurs in J&K. Lieutenant Governor: Manoj Sinha (As of December 2022). ‘Weaving a better future for Cotton 'is the theme of World cotton Day 2022 (October 7).

question: Chief Minister Shramik Kalyan Prakalp scheme was launched by Amit Shah for womenof .
solution: (b)The Tripura government announced a special scheme named “Mukhyamantri Chaa Shramik Kalyan Prakalp” 10th March 2022. The scheme aims to ensure the social security of around 7,000 Tripura’s tea garden workers. Among 7,000 tea garden workers of Tripura, 75% are women.

question: Players that stop dribbling in handball have to pass or shot within:
solution: (d) If a handball player takes more than three steps without dribbling (bouncing the ball) or holds the ball for more than 3 seconds without bouncing it, shooting or passing, then that is deemed 'walking' and possession is lost. Terminology used in Handball: Court player, Goalie, Corner Throw, Corner Throw, Free throw, Penalty throw, Referee’s throw, Dive shot, Goal, Throw-in, Throw-on, Throw out, etc.

question: Which of the following sequence is correct with respect to the Delhi Dynasties?
option_3: Early Turkish Rulers, Rajput dynasties, Khalji dynasty
solution: (d)The Rulers of Delhi: Rajput Dynasties {Tomaras (1165), Ananga Pala (1130 - 1145), Chauhans (1165 - 1192), Prithviraj Chauhan (1175 - 1192)}, Early Turkish Rulers/ Mamluk dynasty {Qutbuddin Aibak (1206 - 1210), Shamsuddin Iltutmish: (1210 - 1236), Raziyya (1236 - 1240), Ghiyasuddin Balban (1266 - 1287)}, Khilji Dynasty {Jalaluddin Khalji (1290 - 1296), Alauddin Khalji (1296 - 1316)}, Tughlaq Dynasty {Ghiyasuddin Tughlaq (1320 - 1324), Muhammad Tughluq (1324 - 1351), Firuz Shah Tughluq (1351 - 1388)}, Sayyid Dynasty {Khizr Khan (1414 - 1421)}, Lodhi Dynasty {Bahlul Lodi (1451 - 1489)}.

question: Which of the following is NOT a classification of E-Commerce?
solution: (b) D2D (Distributor-to-Distributor). Types of e - commerce include B2C (Business to Consumer), B2B (Business to business), C2C (Consumer to Consumer), P2P (Peer to Peer), and M - Commerce (Mobile Commerce). Examples of E-Commerce are Amazon, Flipkart, eBay, Fiverr, Upwork, Olx, Quikr, etc.

question: takes oath as new Meghalaya Governor in October 2022.
solution: (a)B.D Mishra (former brigadier of the Indian Army) sworn in as new Meghalaya Governor in October 2022. He is also the current governor of Arunachal Pradesh (assumed office on 3 October 2017). As of December 2022: AK Anil Kumar (Vice president of International Astronautical Foundation), Prashant Kumar (CEO of Yes Bank), Sunil Barthwal (Commerce Secretary).

question: There are main types of cell division.
solution: (b) There are mainly two types of cell division, such as Mitosis and Meiosis. Mitosis: The process cells use to make exact replicas of themselves. Mitosis is observed in almost all the body’s cells, including eyes, skin, hair, and muscle cells. Meiosis: In this type of cell division, sperm or egg cells are produced instead of identical daughter cells as in mitosis. Binary Fission: Single-celled organisms like bacteria replicate themselves for reproduction.

question: The first session of Indian National congress was held at.
solution: (a)First session of Congress was held at Bombay in 1885 under the presidency of W.C. Bannerjee. 1st session attended by 72 delegates. The Indian National Congress was founded at Bombay in December 1885. Other Congress sessions held in Bombay were in 1889 (President - Sir William Wedderburn), 1904 (Sir Henry Cotton), 1915 (Satyendra Prasanna Sinha), 1918 (Syed Hasan Imam, August/September), and 1934 (Rajendra Prasad). In 1915, another session of congress was held in December (Delhi, Madan Mohan Malaviya).

question: An electric current is expressed by a unit called.
solution: (b)Electric current is defined as the rate of flow of electrons in a conductor. The SI Unit of electric current is the Ampere (1 ampere = 1 coulomb / 1 second). Electric current is a scalar quantity. Metre is the SI unit of length. Watt (W), is the SI unit of power, One joule of energy transferred in a second is equal to 1 watt. Joule is the SI unit of energy, One joule is defined as the amount of energy exerted when a force of one newton is applied over a displacement of one meter.

question: How thick is the lithosphere?
solution: (c)The lithosphere (10-200 km) is the outermost and mechanical layer of the Earth that consists of the entire crust and the top-most portion of the mantle. Mechanically, the earth’s layers can be divided into lithosphere, asthenosphere (80-200 km), mesospheric mantle , outer core, and inner core. Chemically, Earth can be divided into the crust (8-40 kms), upper mantle (640 km), lower mantle (660 - 2700), outer core (2200 km), and inner core (1200 km).

question: Who among the following is related to the musical instrument Santoor?
solution: (a) Pandit Shivkumar Sharma was a Santoor player. Awards and Honors: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1986), the Padma Shri (1991), and the Padma Vibhushan (2001). As a music composer, he collaborated with Indian flutist Hariprasad Chaurasia under the collaborative name Shiv–Hari. Pandit Ravishankar Prasad (Sitar player) and Pandit Jasraj (tabla player).

question: Chemical formula of magnesium oxide is.
solution: (c)Magnesium Oxide (MgO) can be used as an antacid to relieve heartburn, sour stomach, or acid indigestion. MgCO3(Magnesium Carbonate), MgO2 (Magnesium dioxide), and Mg(OH)2(Magnesium hydroxide).

question: The Constitution forbids employment of children below the age of years in dangerous jobs like factories and mines.
solution: (b)Article 24 strictly prohibits the employment of children below the age of14 in any hazardous industry or factories or mines, without exception. The Child Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act, 1986 (renamed as Child & Adolescent Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act, 1986 in 2016) specifically deals with the violations of related to this right. Article 23 and 24 of Indian Constitution deal with the Right against Exploitation. The Article 23 of the Indian Constitution prohibits human trafficking and begar (forced labor without payment) to protect the millions of underprivileged and deprived people of the country.

question: Which of the following is not a natural fibre?
solution: (c)Examples of Natural fibres (Fibres obtained from natural sources like plants and animals) include : Cotton, Silk, Wool, Linen, Jute and Hemp. Examples of Artificial fibres ( Fibres which are manufactured in laboratories) include Rayon, Nylon, Polyester, Acrylic and Aramid.

question: Which of the following statements is NOT correct with reference to the election of the President of India?
option_1: He/She is indirectly elected by the elected MLAs and MPs.
option_2: The President is elected for a period of five years.
option_3: All doubts and disputes in connection with the President's election can be inquired into and decided by both the Supreme Court and the High Courts.
option_4: The election takes place in accordance with the principle of proportional representation.
solution: (c)Any dispute related to the election of the President is taken up by the Supreme Court, the Supreme Court’s decision is final. The fixed value of each vote by an MP of the Rajya Sabha and the Lok Sabha is 700. The value of each MLAs vote is determined by dividing the population of the State by the number of MLAs in its legislative Assembly, and the quotient achieved is further divided by 1000. Articles related to Presidential Election: Article 54 (Election of President), Article 55 (Manner of election of President), Article 56 (Term of office of President), Article 57 (Eligibility for re-election), and Article 58 (Qualifications for election as President).

question: Which of the following is celebrated as the New Year in Tamil Nadu?
solution: (b)Puthandu (Puthuvarudam, Tamil New Year), is the first day of the first Tamil month, Chittirai (14 April) on the Tamil calendar, celebrated as a festival by Tamil Hindus of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry. Pongal (Tai Pongal) is a 3 -4 days Hindu harvest festival celebrated by Tamils in India (Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Puducherry) and Sri Lanka. Ugadi festival (new year festival, celebrated in states of Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and Telangana). Onam (Harvest festival of Kerala).

question: In the early eleventh century, the Chola king Rajendra I built a Shiva temple and filled itwith a Sun-pedestal seized from the ______.
solution: (c)Chola king Rajendra-I (reigned between 1014 and 1044 CE) built a Shiva temple in his capital, Gangaikondacholapuram (north Tamil Nadu) and filled it with prized statues seized from defeated rulers such as Sun-pedestal (Chalukyas), a Ganesha statue and several statues of Durga, a Nandi statue, an image of Bhairava and Bhairavi (Kalingas of Orissa), and a Kali statue (Palas of Bengal).

question: Which of the following offices was NOT held by the poet Harishena?
solution: (c)Nagara-shreshthi (chief banker or merchant). Offices held by Poet Harishena: Maha-danda-Nayaka (chief judicial officer), Kumar-amatya (important minister) and a sandhi-vigrahika (minister of war and peace). Emperor Samudragupta's court poet was Harisena, his poem, Prashati about Samudragupta's courage inscribed on the Allahabad Pillar. Harisena’s other works include Apabramsa Dharma Pariksha, Karpura Prakara , Jagathsundari - Yogamaladikara, Yasodhara Kanta, Astahnikakatha, and Brhatkathakosa.

question: ______ is found in association with rocks composed of calcium carbonates?
solution:
(a)Limestone is a sedimentary rock made of calcium carbonate (CaCO3), usually in the form of calcite or aragonite.

Some other examples of sedimentary include Breccia, Conglomerate, Sandstone, Siltstone, and Shale. These rocks are formed by the deposition and subsequent cementation of the material at the Earth’s surface within the bodies of water.

question: A car starts from point A towards point B, travelling at the speed of 20 km/h. 112 hours later, another car starts from point A and travelling at the speed of 30 km/h and reaches 212 hours before the first car. Find the distance between A and B.
solution:
(b)

the speed of First car be 20 km/h and the speed of second car be 30 km/h

Let ‘t’ be the time taken by the second car to complete the journey.

Then time taken by the first car to complete the journey = (1.5 + t + 2.5)hrs.

Now, equating the total distance in both cases, we get :-

30 × t = 20 × (1.5 + t + 2.5)hrs

⇒30t = 80 + 20t

⇒t = 8 hr

Now, total distance = 30 × t = 30 × 8= 240 km.

question: The difference between a discount of 25% and two successive discounts of 15% and10% on a certain bill was ₹25. Find the amount of the bill.
solution:
(d)

Let , amount be 100%

Net discount of 15% and 10% = 15+ 10-15×10100 = 23.5%

Required difference = 25% - 23.5% = 1.5%

According to question ,

The value of 1.5% = 25 Rs.

The value of amount (100% ) = 251.5×100= Rs 1666.67.

question: A trader has a weighing balance that shows 1300 g for a kg. He further marks up hiscost price by 15%. The net profit percentage is:
solution:
(b)

Weighing balance of the trader shows 1300 gm for 1000 gm .

C.P. : S.P.

By weighting ⇒ 1000 : 1300

By markup ⇒ 100 : 115

--------------------------

C.P. : S.P. ⇒ 100 : 149.5

Net profit % = 149.5 -100100×100 = 49.5%

question: The nearest number which is greater to 87501, and is completely divisible by 765 is :
solution:
(b)Nearest number which is greater to 87501 and is completely divisible by 765 is :- 765×115 = 87975

Short Tricks:-

In this type of question make factor of 765 = 5×3×3×17

And now , check the option which is divisible by 3 , 5 and 17 .

Clearly , 87975 is clearly divisible by 3 , 5 and 17 .

question: Simplify:CosA1 + tanA-sinA1+cotA
solution:
(b)

cosA1+tanA-sinA1+cotA=cosA1+sinAcosA-sinA1+cosAsinA=cos2AcosA+sinA-sin2AsinA+cosA⇒cos2A - sin2AcosA+sinA=(cosA+sinA)(cosA-sinA)(cosA+sinA)=(cosA-sinA)

question: In triangle ABC, the bisector of angle BAC cuts the side BC at D. If AB = 10 cm, and AC= 14 cm, then what is BD : DC ?
solution:
(b)

Theorem:-

In a triangle, the angle bisector of any angle will divide the opposite side in the ratio of the sides containing the angle.

ABAC = BDDC……(angle bisector property )

Here ,

1014 = BDDC⇒BD : DC = 5 : 7

question:
The table given below shows the number of people in different states.

What is the ratio of the number of people in state C to the number of people in state E?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675231962/word/media/image44.png
solution:
(c)

number of people in state C = 144

number of people in state E = 280

Required ratio : - 144 : 280 ⇒ 18 : 35

question: ₹5,000 is divided into two parts such that if one part is invested at 4% and the other at5%, then the whole annual interest from both the sums is ₹223. How much was invested at 4%?
solution:
(b)

Let , the amount invested at 4% is x Rs. Then , the amount invested at 5% will be (5000-x) Rs.

Formula : - Simple Interest = P×R×T100

According to question ,

x×4×1100+(5000-x)×5×1100 = 223

⇒4x -5x + 25000 = 22300

⇒x = Rs 2700.

question:
The table given below shows the number of trucks sold by six companies.

Number of trucks sold by L is what percent of number of trucks sold by J?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675231962/word/media/image46.png
solution:
(c)

number of trucks sold by company L = 80

number of trucks sold by company J = 40

Required percentage : 8040×100= 200%

question: If the volume of a sphere is 24,416.64 cm³, find its surface area (take π=3.14) correct to two places of decimal.
solution:
(b)

Volume of sphere = 43×πr3

Now, = 24416.64 = 43×3.14×r3

⇒r3 = 7776×34 = 5832

⇒r = 18 cm

Now, surface area of sphere = 4πr2 = 4×3.14×18×18 = 4069.44 cm2

question: 11 + Cos(90° - θ ) + 11 - Cos(90° - θ)=
solution:
(a)

11+cos(90°-θ)+11-cos(90°-θ)=11+sinθ+11-sinθ⇒(1-sinθ)+(1+sinθ)1- sin2θ=2cos2θ=2sec2θ

question: If (4a +5a + 5) = 14, what is the value of (16a² + 25a2)?
solution:
(c)

Identities :- when ax +ya = k , then (ax)2 + y2a2= k2-2xy

Now,

4a+5a+5 = 14 ⇒4a+5a= 9 ……e.q.(1)

On squaring e.q.(1) , we get

16a2+25a2 = 92-2×4×5 = 41

question:
Study the following table and answer the question that follows.

A school has four sections A, B, C and D of Class IX students.The results of Science and Mathematics examinations are shown in the following table.

What percentage of students of section C Passed in Science but failed in Mathematics?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675231962/word/media/image48.png
solution:
(a)

Section C students who passed in science but failed in maths their number is 8 , then Required% = 8 92×100= 8.70%

question: Ruchi, Khushi and Teju can do a piece of work in 30, 40 and 60 days respectively. Inhow many days can Ruchi do the work, if she is assisted by both Khushi and Teju on every third day?
solution:
(b)

Total work is 120 units.

Ruchi’s efficiency is 4 units. On every third day she is assisted by Khushi and Teju .

Work done in 3 days = 4+4+(4+3+2) = 17 units

Work done in 21 days = 17 ×7 = 119 units

Remaining work = 120 units - 119 units = 1 units

On 22nd days ruchi work alone , time require to complete 1 unit of work by ruchi = 14 days.

Total days =( 21 + 14 ) days. = 854 days

question: If the diameter of a sphere is 3.5 cm, then what is the total surface area of the sphere?
solution:
(c)

Radius of sphere = 3.52cm

Total surface area of sphere =4πr2 = 4×227×3.52×3.52 = 38.5cm2

question: Ram loses 1212% of his money and after spending 75% of the remainder, is left with ₹630. How much money did Ram have initially?
solution:
(b)

Let , ram has initially 32 units Rs. ,

Then money left after losing 1212% = 32×78 = 28 unit

Finally , money left after spending 75% of the left money = 28×14= 7 units

According to question ,

7 units = 630 Rs. ⇒ 32 units = 32 ×90 = Rs 2880.

question: If x-1x-= 13 then, what will be the value of x4 + 1x4
solution:
(d)

Identity : = when x-1x= k , then x2+1x2= k2+2 x-1x = 13 , then , x2+1x2= 132+2 = 171 And x4+1x4 = 1712-2 = 29241 -2 = 29239

question:
Study the given chart and answer the question that follows.

The chart shows the quantities of machines (M1, M2, M3) available in different stores (S1, S2, S3, S4).

https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675231962/word/media/image51.png
solution:
(d)

Average number of M2 machine per store = 12+8+8+144 = 424= 10.5

Clearly , Store S1 and S4 have more machines than the average number of M2 machines per store .

question: If a ∶ b = c ∶ d, then which of the following ratio is equal to a ∶ c?
solution:
(d)

Let , ab= cd=x …..e.q.(1) ac = bd …..e.q.(2) Then , a=bx and c =dx Now applying componendo and dividendo in e.q.(1) a+ba-b = c+dc-d a+bc+d = a-bc-d = bx-bdx-d =b(x-1)d(x-1) a+bc+d = bd = ac ….from e.q.(2) a+bc+d = ac

question: If (cos q + sin q) = 31/25, then what will be the value of cos² q?
solution:
(d)

Triplets (7,24,25) are used.

question: The average marks of 60 students in a class are 62. The average marks of boys and girls in that subject are 60 and 65, respectively. The number of boys in the class is:
solution:
(a)

Let the no. of boys is x , then the no. of girls be (60-x)

Total mark of 60 students = 62×60 marks = 3720

Now according to question ,

60×x + 65× (60-x) = 3720

⇒5x = 3900 - 3720

⇒x = 36 boys

Short tricks:-

Concept:- When we do alligation on average of identities , we get the ratio of number of identities.

According to question ,

5 units = 60 students

Then , 3 units = 36 boys

question:
Fill in the blank with the correct collocation.

Motorists committing this infraction are ________ fined.
solution:
(d)heavily.

‘Heavily’ means to a great degree. The given sentence states that motorists committing this infraction are heavily fined. Hence, ‘heavily’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

Fair and square
solution:
(a)Fair and square- honestly.

E.g.- Argentina won the FIFA world cup match fair and square.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the givensentence.

I used to swim acrossthe river when I was young.
solution:
(c)could swim across

The modal verb ‘could’ is used for saying that somebody had the ability or was allowed to do something. Similarly, the given sentence states that the narrator had the ability to cross the river when he was young. Hence, ‘could swim across’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that contains a grammatical error in the underlined portion

I have never played any game of side this track during the season.
option_1: I have never played any game off side this track during the season.
option_2: I have never played any game of side this track during the season.
option_3: I have never playedany game off side this track during the season.
option_4: I have never played any game off side this track during the season.
solution:
(b)I have never played any game of side this track during the season.

“Off-side” is used about a player in football in a position that is not allowed by the rules of the game. The sentence in option ‘b’ has the preposition ‘of’ in place of ‘off’ so it must be removed to make the sentence grammatically correct.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

We decided to ___________ as we were missing him a lot.
solution:
(d)pay him a visit

‘Pay him a visit’ means to go somewhere to spend time with someone. The given sentence states that we decided to spend time with him as we were missing him a lot. Hence, ‘pay him a visit’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the correct indirect form of the given sentence.

Latika said to him, “I got a hefty discount on this television.”
option_1: Latika told him that she has got a hefty discount on that television.
option_2: Latika told him that she is getting a hefty discount on that television.
option_3: Latika told him that she had got a hefty discount on that television.
option_4: Latika told him that she has got a hefty discount on this television.
solution:
(c)Latika told him that she had got a hefty discount on that television.

(a) Latika told him that she hasgot a hefty discount on that television. (Incorrect Verb)

(b) Latika told him that she is getting a hefty discount on that television. (Incorrect Tense)

(d) Latika told him that she hasgot a hefty discount on this television. (Incorrect Verb)

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

One who mediates in a deal or complex situation
solution:
(d)Negotiator- one who mediates in a deal or complex situation

Equaliser- a thing which has an equalizing effect

Solicitor- a lawyer whose job is to give legal advice, prepare legal documents and arrange the buying and selling of land, etc.

Pacifier- a person or thing that pacifies someone or something

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.

Ambition
solution:
(d)Laziness- the quality of not being willing to work or use any effort

Ambition- something that you very much want to have or do

Intent- showing great attention

Anxiety- a feeling of worry or fear, especially about the future

Object- a thing that can be seen and touched, but is not alive

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the word ‘stagnant’ from the followingSentence.

Reeta was motionless after knowing that her brother had become mentally unstable after seeing the fatal accident on Tuesday night.
solution:
(a)Motionless- someone or something that is motionless is not moving at all

Stagnant- not flowing and therefore dirty and having an unpleasant smell

Fatal- causing or ending in death

Unstable- likely to change or fail

Accident- an unpleasant event that happens unexpectedly and causes damage, injury or death

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

Last before year, Shirley got very good grades.
solution:
(c)The year before last

‘The year before last’ means during the year before the previous one. The given sentence states that Shirley got very good grades in the year before the previous one. Hence, ‘The year before last’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the correct passive form of the given sentence.

The new owners hired a lot of new servers.
option_1: A lot of new servers were hired by the new owners.
option_2: A lot of new servers are being hired by the new owners.
option_3: A lot of new servers are hired by the new owners.
option_4: A lot of new servers had been hired by the new owners.
solution:
(a) A lot of new servers were hired by the new owners.

(b) A lot of new servers are being hired by the new owners. (Incorrect Tense)

(c) A lot of new servers are hired by the new owners. (Incorrect Tense)

(d) A lot of new servers had been hired by the new owners. (Incorrect Tense)

question: Select the sentences that contains no spelling errors.
option_1: I heard raucouos laughter from the next room.
option_2: I heard raocous laughter from the next room.
option_3: I heard raucus laughter from the next room.
option_4: I heard raucous laughter from the next room.
solution:
(d) I heard raucous laughter from the next room.

‘Raucous’ is the correct spelling which is only given in option ‘d’.

Raucous - making or constituting a disturbingly harsh and loud noise

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the bracketed word to fill in the blank.

There is a huge generation __________ (void) between Arun and his grandparents.
solution:
(b)Gap- an empty space in something or between two things

Void- a large empty space

Traditions- the transmission of customs or beliefs from generation to generation

Memory- a person’s ability to remember things

Experience- the things that you have done in your life

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word in the given sentence.

The perilsof smoking tobacco can never be ignored.
solution:
(c)Hazards- a danger or risk

Perils- something that is very dangerous

Delights- to give somebody great pleasure

Benefits- an advantage or useful effect that something has

Humiliations- the feeling of being ashamed or losing respect for yourself,

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

I am been working here for the past ten years.
solution:
(a) have been working here

“Have been + V-ing + for + time duration” is the correct grammatical structure for the given sentence. Hence, ‘have been working here’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

Seeing my messy room, my mother taught me to keep everything in order. Now my room is ________.
solution:
(c) spick and span.

‘Spick and span’ is an idiom that means neat, clean, and well looked after. The given sentence talks about the narrator’s room which is now neat, clean, and well looked after. Hence, ‘spick and span’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment thatcontains a grammatical error.

There is a whole world / out there that / is invisible from / the naked eye.
solution:
(b)is invisible from.

There is a prepositional error in the given sentence. The preposition ‘from’ must be replaced with ‘to’. Hence, ‘is invisible to the naked eye’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentences in passive voice

Had they not cleared the exam?
option_1: Is the exam not been cleared by them?
option_2: Have the exam not been cleared by them?
option_3: Was the exam not been cleared by them?
option_4: Had the exam not been cleared by them?
solution:
(d) Had the exam not been cleared by them?

(a) Isthe exam not been cleared by them? (Incorrect Verb)

(b) Havethe exam not been cleared by them? (Incorrect Verb)

(c) Wasthe exam not been cleared by them? (Incorrect Verb)

question:
The question below consists of a set of labeled sentences. Out of the four optionsgiven, select the most logical order of the sentences to form a coherent paragraph.

P. In Tokyo, they built an expressway linking the international airport in Haneda to the centre, and widened some of the city’s major arteries.

Q. These infrastructure improvements helped to bring about the Japanese economic miracle over the next couple of decades.

R. Tokyo 2020 was supposed to be a great economic stimulus, replicating the achievements of Tokyo 1964.

S. It was thanks to hosting that Olympics that Japan invested in infrastructure such as the famous Shinkansen bullet train .
solution:
(a)RSPQ.

Sentence R will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. Tokyo 2020 Olympics However, Sentence S states that it was thanks to hosting that Olympics that Japan invested in infrastructure such as the famous Shinkansen bullet train. So, S will follow R. Further, Sentence P states that in Tokyo, they built an expressway linking the international airport in Haneda to the centre, and widened some of the city’s major arteries & Sentence Q states that these infrastructure improvements helped to bring about the Japanese economic miracle over the next couple of decades. So, Q will follow P. Going through the options, option a has the correct sequence.

question:
In the given sentence the underlined word may have been incorrectly spelt. Identifythe option that rectifies the spelling. If there is no error in spelling, select ‘No error’.

Getting a compliment from her husband was a rare occurrancein Rashmila’s life
solution:
(a)occurrence.

‘Occurrence’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Cloze Test :

Academic life has (96) _________ demanding for students as a result of different internal and external expectations. Teenagers are especially (97)__________ to academic stress because they go through so many personal and social changes. As a result, designing effective and efficient (98) _________ solutions requires a thorough understanding of the causes and consequences of academic stress. Exams are one of the (99)_________ aspects of anyone's life. Exams are stressful for everyone, whether they are students or adults because everyone wants to perform well and no one wants to fail as to avoid (100) ________ in future.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 96.
solution:
(c)become.

“Has + V3” is the correct grammatical structure for the given sentence. Hence, ‘become(V3)’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :

Academic life has (96) _________ demanding for students as a result of different internal and external expectations. Teenagers are especially (97)__________ to academic stress because they go through so many personal and social changes. As a result, designing effective and efficient (98) _________ solutions requires a thorough understanding of the causes and consequences of academic stress. Exams are one of the (99)_________ aspects of anyone's life. Exams are stressfwants to perform well and no one wants to fail as to avoid (100) ________ in future.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 97.
solution:
(b)prone.

‘Prone’ means likely to suffer from something or to do something bad. The given passage states that Teenagers are especially prone to academic stress. Hence, ‘prone’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :

Academic life has (96) _________ demanding for students as a result of different internal and external expectations. Teenagers are especially (97)__________ to academic stress because they go through so many personal and social changes. As a result, designing effective and efficient (98) _________ solutions requires a thorough understanding of the causes and consequences of academic stress. Exams are one of the (99)_________ aspects of anyone's life. Exams are stressful for everyone, whether they are students or adults because everyone wants to perform well and no one wants to fail as to avoid (100) ________ in future.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 98.
solution:
(b)intervention.

‘Intervention’ means the act or fact or a means of interfering with the outcome or course. The given passage states that designing effective and efficient intervention solutions requires a thorough understanding of the causes and consequences of academic stress. Hence, ‘intervention’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :

Academic life has (96) _________ demanding for students as a result of different internal and external expectations. Teenagers are especially (97)__________ to academic stress because they go through so many personal and social changes. As a result, designing effective and efficient (98) _________ solutions requires a thorough understanding of the causes and consequences of academic stress. Exams are one of the (99)_________ aspects of anyone's life. Exams are stressful for everyone, whether they are students or adults because everyone wants to perform well and no one wants to fail as to avoid (100) ________ in future.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 99.
solution:
(c)most crucial.

‘Superlative degree adjective’ denotes the form of an adjective or adverb that expresses the highest or a very high degree of quality of a thing, person, etc. For example, best, worst, greatest, etc. However, we always place the definite article ‘the’ before any superlative adjective. Similarly, in the given sentence, ‘most’ is the superlative degree adjective. Hence, ‘most crucial’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :

Academic life has (96) _________ demanding for students as a result of different internal and external expectations. Teenagers are especially (97)__________ to academic stress because they go through so many personal and social changes. As a result, designing effective and efficient (98) _________ solutions requires a thorough understanding of the causes and consequences of academic stress. Exams are one of the (99)_________ aspects of anyone's life. Exams are stressful for everyone, whether they are students or adults because everyone wants to perform well and no one wants to fail as to avoid (100) ________ in future.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 100.
solution:
(a)ambiguity.

‘Ambiguity’ means something that can be understood in more than one way. The given passage states that no one wants to fail to avoid ambiguity in future. Hence, ‘ambiguity’ is the most appropriate answer.
